title: Always something new and exciting to learn
text: Open minded and very fast paced different the most enjoyable part is helping the customers and working with the blue shirts. working holidays will seem bad but not really and working with others they make you feel comfortable.

title: Steady work
text: I've worked here for over 6 years. There are many long-term employees. You will know in the first year if this is a place you would like to stay. The company is good and profitable. Middle management is hit or miss. You really have to brag about yourself to get ahead.

title: As long as you are good at your work it will be fine
text: If you keep up with your work it wouldn't matter much. But in order to survive you cant depend on your manager but let your wrok prove you every time. Working wise, its easy and continuous process improvement gives you the challenge one needs to motivate themselves.

title: Never work here
text: Extremely poor management. Very racist as well, if you are not Korean you will never be hired by the company. They will just waste your time and do not provide benefits until after 6 months of working.

title: Toxic workplace culture that slowly wears on everyone
text: This is a good company to have on your resume, and your contribution to the company is heavily reliant on your department position and title level.  Other than this, the workplace culture and policies are extremely toxic. The employees are not valued as assets to the company, but rather seen as a number with a title level. People below management level are mostly disregarded and the overall environment has a regressive attitude that parallels 1960’s corporate culture, more so than anything in the 21st century.  Your safety and well being is only important if it impacts profits, otherwise you are readily sacrificed if it means maintaining production. Management rarely tries to build a team atmosphere. From my experience, most of management seem primarily concerned with the politics, looking good to their bosses, and acting as a mouthpiece for issuing new policy and department requirements with no feedback, since the opinions and voices of the employees below them are treated with extreme insignificance.

title: Do not know
text: Is a  an average company when it comes to opportunities. Rewards are not in pace with achievements and offer little incentives to progress within the organization
reviewer: IOT LTE/5G Test and Protocol Engineer

title: Mixed bag for a tech writer
text: GOOD: The people. Almost to a person, the folks that I interacted with were really good folks. I was part of the group that were the initial occupants of the preexisting facility that was finished out for Samsung at Legacy Central in Plano TX. The new facilities were very nice. The honor system snacks and drinks (not monitored by cashiers, but by cameras) with self-checkout were a great perk. BAD: Open office floor plan. It may have been the trendy thing to do for "working collaboratively" but, as a writer who needed a little peace and quiet to formulate my thoughts, I was not a fan. Samsung committed to the concept in the new facility well before the pandemic. Since I lost my job while we were still working from home, I'm not going to see in person how this plays out. But the preliminary answer to how to practice social distancing in the open office is to put a person a every other desk and alternate days when people come into the facility. I guess in an age of social distancing, working remotely will become the norm.

title: Great Company!
text: I love the work environment. The company takes care of the employee so much. The benifits are the best specially the health benifits. Would highly recommend this company!

title: Not the best place to work.
text: The company is hard to figure out. There is a lot of politics and favoritism. Career advancement is non-existent or only applies to select employees who are favored by management. The company is more of a Korean company with Korean culture than an American company.  Innovation is non-existent and some of the managers are more interested in the hours you put in at work instead of productivity.

title: Productive work place
text: I enjoyed my time at Samsung but,  I was over worked with a low pay of income , Also favoritism accured a lot from others. I’ve tried multiple times relocating to a different complex but was turned down on all offers.

title: A day at work
text: fast working  Great teamwork  Great communication  Sometimes get bonuses It’s fun  They let us talk longest we were working  And they ordered food food for lunch

title: Two year company
text: They will pay you well but there wasn’t really work life balance. The domestic leadership doesn’t really call the shots on business decisions; leaders in Korea do.  English is not always spoken and you may not always know what is being said.  Challenging environment. They pay well but put the products above their culture and people. The people are nice for the most part.

title: Good company for college graduates
text: Not recommend if you are an experienced expert who wants to have a job in Samsung Electronics unless you are so strong to survive in bureaucratic environment.
reviewer: Senior Manager of Global Service Group

title: Stay away
text: Work/life balance is not good. Disconnect between the Asian and American cultures is vast. Organizational structure is lacking, and confidence in adequacy of management is minimal, at best.

title: Work long hours and point system change
text: Samsung is a good company to work for but they have a lot of improvement to do. The management team definitely needs a major turn around. Favoritism is a big factor too.

title: Ótimo
text: Lugar maravilhoso onde teve total transparência e honestidade para comigo e demais colegas.

title: Good workplace
text: Productive and good environment. Fun people. Bright, energetic and creative environment. Definitely secure and safe. Social distance and other protocols implemented and maintained.

title: Excelente
text: Excelente empresa para trabajar, ya que en todo momento te capacitan y te entregan todas las herramientas necesarias para desarrollarte de buena forma en el punto de venta.

title: The epitome of a 'sweatshop'.....truly awful
text: SSC brings out the worst in everyone there, which is sad to watch. Both executive and local senior leadership have sadly mismanaged this area even before it came to fruition.  Don't fall for the company name - you with take nothing with you but painful memories of what not to do.

title: A fast paced technology juggernaut
text: The company offers incredible learning opportunities and chances for growth; you won't be bored and will always be challenged pushing yourself forward.
